mode.title: Mode: way to allocate funds in created orders.

spread_percent.title: Spread, price difference between buy and sell orders: percent of the current price to use as spread (difference between highest buy and lowest sell).

increment_percent.title: Increment, price difference between grid orders: percent of the current price to use as increment between orders. WARNING: this should to be lower than the Spread value: profitability is close to Spread-Increment.

lower_bound.title: Lower bound, lower limit of the grid: minimum price to start placing buy orders from: lower limit of the grid.

upper_bound.title: Upper bound, upper limit of the grid: maximum price to stop placing sell orders from.

operational_depth.title: Operational depth: maximum number of orders to be maintained on exchange.

mirror_order_delay.title: Mirror order delay: Seconds to wait for before creating a mirror order when an order is filled. This can generate extra profits on quick market moves.

use_existing_orders_only.title: Use existing orders only: when checked, new orders will only be created upon pre-existing orders fill. OctoBot won't create orders at startup: it will use the ones already on exchange instead. This mode allows staggered orders to operate on user created orders. Can't work on trading simulator.
